Pre-Game Insights: Bahrain will take on Malaysia in their second AFC Asian Cup group game at the Jassim Bin Hamad Stadium on Saturday. Both teams lost their opening games in Group E and will be looking for their first win of the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will be played at the Jassim Bin Hamad Stadium on Saturday, with kick-off at 2.30pm GMT for fans in the UK.
The match will be shown live on TrillerTV in the UK. Match highlights will be available on the platform and Asian Cup YouTube channel after the game.
Others: Amine Benaddi's availability for the upcoming match is uncertain as the centre-back had to be carried off injured at half-time against South Korea, leading to Sayed Baqer taking his place.
Abdullah Al-Hashsash secured the lone goal for Bahrain on the first matchday of this tournament, marking only the second goal in his international career.
Should Safawi Rasid score this weekend, he can climb to the seventh position in the list of all-time scorers.
